content:
I agree with your statement. it is important for individuals to take responsibility for their social media use and to prioritize their mental health and well-being over the fleeting validation of likes and followers. 

while social media can be a powerful tool for communication, self-expression, and building community, it can also have negative effects on mental health, self-esteem, and overall well-being if not used mindfully. 

practicing mindfulness, setting healthy boundaries, and seeking support when needed can all be helpful strategies for maintaining a healthy relationship with social media. by prioritizing self-care and personal responsibility, individuals can mitigate the negative effects of social media and use it in a way that supports their overall well-being.
